stories.title: Show HN: A developer reverse web proxy

stories.text:
I believe their system limits users based on past payment and IP address history.

Limitation seems to concern paid features only for the time being (I only realized this when I couldn't sponsor a project yesterday).

As long as you are limited, you cannot update your billing address.

The only way to lift the restrictions is the appeals form*, which requires submitting a non-Russian photo ID. Apparently, a Russian user who paid Github from Russia or with a Russian billing address at least once must obtain another citizenship (probably not a problem for the wealthy ones?) to keep using their existing Github account fully.

* https://docs.github.com/en/site-policy/other-site-policies/github-and-trade-controls#how-is-github-ensuring-that-folks-not-living-in-andor-having-professional-links-to-the-sanctioned-countries-and-territories-still-have-access-or-ability-to-appeal
